While not documented, integration intents are provided. See https://github.com/tobykurien/BatteryFu/blob/master/AndroidManifest.xml#L72 - send Intent with action "batteryfu.intent.action.TOGGLE" and data URI "data://on" or "onlinemode://on" for e.g.

title: Saving battery & data!
comment: 2 of the most important aspects of your phone: 1: Battery life. More or less doubled as the unnecessary radios are switched off while phone is not using them (normally they remain on in the background) 2: Data. Reduced, as unnecessary background updates are not performed (do you really care if Android only checks for system updates every couple hours?)  Great app and so small, keep it up!

If the wifi is turned on only a fraction of the time, then much more should be left available.  Needs work.

title: Top App works perfectly on Samsung YP-G70
comment: I have been looking for something like this for ages but missed it because I was searching under WiFi for a toggling device. This app is totally user configurable and you can choose whether or not to toggle mobile data, which I would not want to do unless I had an unlimited data plan. You can choose to have an icon on the notification bar and detailed status information is also given in the notification area, which is useful. The app is only a few kilobytes and uses virtually no power itself. If you use BatteryFU's own menu (main screen) to control your WiFi, you will not create any conflicts with scheduled events. A 2-star reviewer has not realised this! It works perfectly and is completely reliable. Also works well on my wife's Sony Xperia. BatteryFU is better than some similar paid-for apps, is free and I have not seen any adverts so a big thank you to the developer. EXCELLENT

title: Galaxy S
comment: Maybe bug?  When Standart mode (with "Wait till screen unlocked") selected after Offline mode, Data don't restored (if enabled). Display at this time is turned on. Good way - save state before change mode, and restore it if needed. It would be nice if you add "marker" in menu from status bar for active mode (Standart, Online, Offline, Night).   For example:  * Standart mode (Data managed by app, if selected)   Online mode.    Offline mode.   Nignt mode     (Data managed by app, if selected)  If user manually switch Data off, marker must be "Offline mode".   Standart mode   Online mode  *Offline mode (always offline)   Night mode  If user manually switch Data on, marker must be "Online mode".   Standart mode  *Online mode (always online)   Offline mode    Night mode  After select "Standart mode" or "Night mode" data managed by app.  Sorry for my English :)
